Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2014 01:20AM marcinca3 wrote: Biopsy, biopsy, biopsy.    If you do the MRI, and results are negative, please get the biopsy.   And if that's negative, and you are still concerned, then just remove the lump.    I had breast cancer 2 x, and each time it was  unusually hard to diagnose.    Multiple mamms, ultrasounds, MRI's and even one biopsy came back normal...and all wrong.    That 's highly unusual for my very normal type of breast cancer .    It's taught me to go for the biopsies and go with pathology reports,  and not rely on somebody's "best guess".
Posts.Title: Palpable Lump, Negative Mammogram and U/S MyLittleTrout sarahjane7374
